perturbation.original_text: You will have ten (10) days after written notice of such default from us within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require). If you do not cure the default within such 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require), this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time period.
perturbation.changed_text: You will have five (5) days after written notice of such default from us within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 5-day period. If you do not cure the default within such 5-day period, this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time period.
perturbation.explanation: Reduced the cure period for monetary defaults to 5 days, conflicting with standard business practices and potentially state laws that require a reasonable cure period, often longer than 5 days, before termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially contradicts state laws requiring reasonable notice and cure periods for contract defaults, varying by jurisdiction but generally exceeding 5 days.

perturbation.original_text: For any default not covered under Sections 15.1 [Termination By Us Without Notice], 15.2 [Termination By Us Without A Cure Period], or 15.3 above, you will have thirty (30) days after written notice of default from us within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 30-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require). If you do not cure the default within the specified time, this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time period.
perturbation.changed_text: For any default not covered under Sections 15.1 [Termination By Us Without Notice], 15.2 [Termination By Us Without A Cure Period], or 15.3 above, you will have fourteen (14) days after written notice of default from us within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 14-day period. If you do not cure the default within the specified time, this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time period.
perturbation.explanation: Reduced the cure period for non-monetary defaults to 14 days, which might not be considered a reasonable timeframe for rectifying certain complex or significant breaches, depending on the specific default and applicable state law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with state laws mandating reasonable opportunity to cure breaches of contract, where 14 days may be deemed insufficient for certain defaults.

perturbation.original_text: Any and all claims and actions arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the relationship between you and us, or your operation of the Restaurant, brought by any party hereto against the other, must be commenced within one (1) year from the occurrence of the facts giving rise to such claim or action, or, it is expressly acknowledged and agreed by all parties, such claim or action will be irrevocably barred.
perturbation.changed_text: Any and all claims and actions arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the relationship between you and us, or your operation of the Restaurant, brought by any party hereto against the other, must be commenced within six (6) months from the occurrence of the facts giving rise to such claim or action, or, it is expressly acknowledged and agreed by all parties, such claim or action will be irrevocably barred.
perturbation.explanation: Reduced the statute of limitations for claims related to the agreement to 6 months.  This may conflict with state laws that prescribe longer limitations periods for contract claims, making the contractual limitation unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflicts with state statutes of limitations for contract claims, which are often longer than 6 months.
